qas.question: Thomas Watson Sr. stepped down in what year?
In 1956 the company demonstrated the first example of what?
What computer did Arthur L. Samuel program to play checkers in 1957?
In 1957 the FORTRAN language was created, what is FORTRAN short for?
In 1961 who became the president of IBM?
In what year did Albert L. Williams step down from the company?
What did Albert L. Willaims program to learn from its experience when playing checkers?
What machine was created by FORTRAN in 1952?
What system was developed for FORTRAN in 1952 to help it play checkers?
In what year did IBM open its first office in Poughkeepsie?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>1952<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Thomas Watson, Sr., stepped down after almost 40 years at the company helm; his son, Thomas Watson, Jr., was named president. In <b9_0>1956<b9_0/>, the company demonstrated the first practical example of <a1_0>artificial intelligence<a1_0/> when Arthur L. Samuel of IBM's Poughkeepsie, New York, laboratory programmed <a2_0><b6_0>an IBM 704<b6_0/><a2_0/> not merely to play checkers but "learn" from its own experience. In 1957, the FORTRAN (<a3_0>FORmula TRANslation<a3_0/>) scientific programming language was developed. In 1961, Thomas J. Watson, Jr., was elected chairman of the board and <a4_0>Albert L. Williams<a4_0/> became company president. The same year IBM developed the <b8_0>SABRE<b8_0/> (Semi-Automatic Business-Related Environment) reservation system for American Airlines and introduced the highly successful <b7_0>Selectric typewriter<b7_0/>.
